founders.name: Kenny Rueter
founders.bio_summary: Software engineer who built a PVC sprinkler toy for his kids and, after struggling to monetize a how-to video, started Kajabi to sell digital products.

founders.name: Travis Rosser
founders.bio_summary: Co-founded Kajabi with Kenny Rueter in 2010 to package the tools creators needed to launch online businesses.

category: All-in-one platform for online courses, memberships, podcasts, and digital products
product_summary: Kajabi provides website, digital product hosting, email marketing, payments, and analytics in one subscription so creators can sell courses, memberships, downloads, and podcasts without stitching tools together.
pricing: Pricing page lists tiered plans (Kickstarter/Basic/Growth/Pro) with product and contact limits, no revenue sharing, and standard payment processing fees via Kajabi Payments (details outlined on the official pricing page).

core_problem.statement: Rueter could not monetize a how-to video for his sprinkler toy and built Kajabi to unify the tools needed to own and sell digital content directly.

kpi.value: 75M+ end customers and 100K+ businesses launched on Kajabi

competition.name: Teachable
competition.reason_compared: Competes for creators selling courses and coaching with hosted checkout and analytics.

competition.name: Thinkific
competition.reason_compared: Another course platform with memberships and communities for similar creator audiences.

competition.name: Podia
competition.reason_compared: Lightweight all-in-one platform for courses, downloads, and memberships.

user_validation.detail: $10B+ in creator revenue disclosed on the pricing page FAQ.

market_background.insight: Kajabi reports 100K+ businesses and $10B+ creator revenue, indicating strong demand for owned digital product infrastructure beyond marketplace platforms.

sources.note: Company profile with founding story, HQ, active users, and employee count.
Official pricing page stating $10B+ creator revenue, 75M+ customers served, and 100K+ businesses built on Kajabi with no revenue share.

feasibility.reason: Founding narrative and current scale are documented by public sources, and the official site reports creator revenue and customer counts.
